article.headline: Pacific 76, UC Riverside 53
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. -- Chad Troyer scored a season-high 23 points with five assists to lead Pacific to a 76-53 victory over UC Riverside on Saturday night at Spanos Center. Troyer made seven 3-pointers to spark the rout, including three during a 17-0 run that turned a tie game into a 47-30 Pacific advantage early in the second half. Pacific stretched its lead to 68-45 with 3:29 to play on 3-pointers by Troyer and James Doran, and coach Bob Thomason cleared his bench the rest of the way as the Tigers recorded their most lopsided win of the season. Doran scored 15 points for Pacific (9-5, 2-1 Big West), Bryan LeDuc came off the bench for 11 points and 7 rebounds and Anthony Brown had 10 points and 6 rebounds. Kyle Austin led Riverside with 17 points and Javon Borum scored 11 for the Highlanders (9-6, 2-2). Pacific turned the game into a blowout by shooting 65 percent from the field in the second half. The Tigers made 13-of-26 shots beyond the 3-point arc with Troyer and Doran combining to make 10. The game was tied seven times and there were five lead changes in the first half before Pacific pulled away in the final minutes. Riverside connected on four consecutive 3-pointers midway through the half to match its biggest lead at 26-23, but Pacific answered with a 14-4 run to take a 37-30 lead at halftime. The Tigers scored the first 10 points of the second half and cruised to the finish while building a lead that reached 26 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
